SENT.plain: Over a 1-year period, a 60-year-old woman had nine episodes of transient weakness, clumsiness, and hypesthesia of the right upper extremity
Angiography revealed normal extracranial vessels and a left middle cerebral artery aneurysm
The aneurysmal sac, removed at operation, had an organized thrombus, which was believed to be the cause of the transient ischemic attacks
Postoperatively, the patient has remained free of neurological symptoms
